articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Asia's manufacturers faced worsening pressure in October with factory activity in China slipping back into decline, clouding recovery prospects for the region's major exporters already squeezed by weaker global demand and higher prices.
articles.title: Asia's factories squeezed as China's nascent recovery teeters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) is aiming to make 200,000 units of its electric pickup truck, Cybertruck, per year, Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Musk says Tesla aims to make 200,000 Cybertrucks a year

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's factory activity unexpectedly contracted in October, a private survey showed on Wednesday, raising questions over the state of the country's fragile economic recovery at the start of the fourth quarter.
articles.title: China's factory activity contracts in October - Caixin PMI

articles.author: Jason Xue, Summer Zhen
articles.description: China's annus horribilis has seen its stock markets fall, funds run up losses and foreign investors run for the exit. But areas of the market dominated by small stocks and frequented by the country's retail investors have done surprisingly well.
articles.title: Micro stocks shine in China's flagging share market

articles.author: Dan Levine, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) on Tuesday won the first U.S. trial over allegations that its Autopilot driver assistant feature led to a death, a major victory for the automaker as it faces several other similar lawsuits across the country.
articles.title: Tesla wins first US Autopilot trial involving fatal crash

articles.author: Clare Jim, Yu Xie, Scott Murdoch
articles.description: China Evergrande (3333.HK) is trying to stave off liquidation by revising its debt restructuring plan, but its biggest challenge will be convincing its creditors, and shareholders in two of its units, that the proposal is worth their while.
articles.title: Analysis: Evergrande will struggle to revive its debt restructuring plan

articles.author: Scott Disavino, Nerijus Adomaitis
articles.description: Energy giants BP(BP.L) and Norway's Equinor(EQNR.OL) have booked hundreds of millions of dollars worth of impairments on their U.S. offshore wind power portfolios in recent days, the latest examples of a renewable energy industry in turmoil.
articles.title: Explainer: Why the US offshore wind industry is in the doldrums

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes hit a densely populated refugee camp in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 50 Palestinians and a Hamas commander, and medics struggled to treat the casualties, even setting up operating rooms in hospital corridors.
articles.title: Israeli military jets strike Gaza camp, says Hamas commander killed

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. senators from both parties voiced doubts on Tuesday about House Republicans' plan to provide $14.3 billion in aid to Israel by cutting Internal Revenue Service funding, without providing aid to Ukraine, and Democratic President Joe Biden threatened to veto the bill were it to pass.
articles.title: US House Republicans' Israel-only aid bill opposed in Senate, by Biden

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WeWork (WE.N) plans to file for bankruptcy as early as next week, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, as the SoftBank Group-backed company struggles with a massive debt pile and hefty losses.
articles.title: WeWork plans to file for bankruptcy as early as next week, source says
